creator: pavel@rs-com.com
text:
Dear Sirs,

I'm very sorry that is not an Apache bug, but I have no found any information 
about it except for unknown WinCGI.

Have trouble with transferring symbol 0x0d trough standart input/output under 
os windows. It is actual when cgi-script reads data from standart input when 
multipart/form-data enctype is used and file content is transferred. So, 
symbols 0x0d simply disappears from the stream.

Configuration: Apache 2.2.3, Win XP SP2

Can you say something about this trouble? May be some configuration options 
allow file content coding in %XX notation? Or maybe Apache supports wincgi?

Thank you!

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
its a user question - whatever is written to apache will be sent to the client.

you probably open the stream in 'unix text mode' so your \r\n's become \n
